This is the worst movie I've seen for a few years. It's a mish-mash of ripped-off ideas from other (read: cash-making) classics - Terminator and Hunger Games are the first to come to mind. How cheesy to have a heroine, 98 years after the doom of civilization enter the scene in a tight body outfit, arrow (ok, a crossbow ;), perfect make-up and a smart-ass remark. Yes, dialogues are terrible, and so is acting). And so is the "voiceover" for the dimmer / lazier of the audience, to explain what is actually happening. Looking at how bad the movie is, and yet, with a 6.4 out of 10 rating, the allegations of rating-bumpings take on some credibility :/

p.s. it appears I'm not the only one to have registered on IMDb to protest against false reviews bumping up this awful, awful production!

I feel sorry for John Cusack. He must be desperate to end up in s film this poor. The acting is very poor , the special effects are very poor, the directing is poor. The only amusing part was to cast an actor who looks a bit like Jennifer Lawrence and they even give her a crossbow. Very useful for killing robots. This movie is appalling. I could not follow through to the end. I hope for your sake you do not waste your time with this rubbish.

review_title: I personally find it very good
review_detailed_main:
The movie is something you do not see often in the cinemas, it's something mind-blowing and located in a futuristic scenario. I see a lot of people saying that it is not worth to see it... They're absolutely wrong. If the film was written by Cristopher Nolan, everybody would say that it is incredible, but everybody is expecting something amazing, not considering that the 90% of the movies made in Hollywood are worse, and rate Singularity very low. That people deserve films like "Baywatch" for the rest of their life. Before seeing it, you should consider that it is not a high budget film and the director is young; and I find the idea so good, so I can say the director is very talented; the actors have not a lot of experience (except of John Cusack), but they managed to act very well (ofc they're not Johnny Depp or Emma Stone, but still.). Anyway, The graphics are as good as a Transformers movie, maybe the lights are a little bit strange sometimes, but the work with the green screen is undoubtedly very very well made. I didn't expect something amazing, but the film left me stunned, I believe in the director and in the actors, they have a bright future.

I want to give a 10/10 to support, the film himself, considering the whole world of cinema, could be easily a 7.5/10.

review_title: Ok I know my rating is high

review_detailed_main:
Crikey this is a bad movie.. Pity a no star rating is possible.

Slow, glaciers move faster

Acting, good idea, let's add some as not even Cussak acts well in this. I doubt the two leads have a future in the industry.

Direction? A child would have directed it better.

Plot, predictable with no real twists with which to hold your attention.

CGI is so bad and not credible.

Path left open or a follow up which, if ever made, would be a crime against cinema.

To be honest, replace Kronos with Skynet and you kind of have the basic premise behind the movie.

review_title: So bad i don't know what to make of it
review_detailed_main:
This is the first review i've ever written. And it's just to tell you guys how bad this movie was. IMDb says 6/10, more like 2/10 at the most.

With John Cusack in the movie you'd think that they pick to outstanding actors in the 2 lead rolls. But the girl has zero talent and the guy may be a little bit better. Terrible graphics and a very loooong and boring movie.

review_title: There are plenty of good low-budget sci-fi, this is not one of them.
review_detailed_main:
First I'd like to say that there's a little value in this film, very little, if any. Plot is a strange snooze fest which makes even less sense as the film concludes. The acting is sub-par, at best (John Cusack, Jeannine Wacker), but completely trashed by Julian Schaffner (I'm sorry but he should really consider another career). The FX is poor and seem effortless, sometimes even comical.

In short, there are plenty of good low-budget sci-fi, but this is not one of them. I desperately tried to understand what the film was trying to say, if anything, but could only conclude that's it's a ~90 minute effortless attempt of something. Truthfully I can't find any reason to recommend this to any type of viewer, and I hate to say it, because I believe there is some value in most films, but this one is best to stay away from.

review_title: John Cusak has gone from bad to terrible to worse
review_detailed_main:
I hardly *ever* offer a rating, preferring to just rate the movies I watch. But this one is special... so very special.

3 minutes in, and it had my country's CBD skyline. All blurry like, which lead me to suspect an el-cheapo picture substitute. 8 minutes in and it already started to feel like a turkey of a movie. 17 minutes in, and I was compelled to read the reviews.

Every single review is correct. This is so bad, it's on another level altogether.

John must have needed the money to fix his house or something because this is the worst of all the bad films he's done. I particularly remember the turkeys which were Cell, and 2012.

Don't waste your time. And if you're curious nevertheless, don't say you haven't been warned 0.o

review_title: How can this movie be rated 5.9. Come on
review_detailed_main:
How can i say. After 20 minutes i have just watch it in fast mode. just to see the end.

This movie is bad.Special effects are crap and actors are not playing well. It is a shame because i think that it is possible to do a much better movie with this story.

Seriously, this film was an amateur attempt at film making using a script that must have been written for complete idiots.

John Cusack, might be a well known and respected actor must he be damned embarrassed with the result of this film. Even he couldn't pull any of this film into order.

After we initially learn about humanity fate, it goes goes from bad to worse. The script must have been thrown together by a machine. The script lacks fluidity and appears to have been patched together with a rusty needle, nothing feels coherent.

None of the actors gave anything other than amateur performances, providing neither sentiment or credibility but then again they were using poorly written text, were poorly directed and they had to deal with a terrible story-line.

This was pure torture, from beginning to end..

There are two reasons you find yourself compelled to share your thoughts about a movie: You find it very good or very bad. This one was the latter. When I started watching it it had 6.7 points at IMDb. So I gave it a try. It had deserved non of them. The acting was poor, the plot stupid, the plot-holes many, the dialogues embarrassing, the ending threatening with an even stupider sequel. A singularity is a future event beyond which one can not make any predictions. Most of the movie was perfectly predictable. The only reason why some of the turns where indeed not predictable, was because I could simply not anticipate the level of ruthless incompetence of the scriptwriter leaving tons of unanswered and unanswerable questions: Where does that cornfield come from? Why does that facility burn down? Why where there at all any trains 37 years after the event? Why should groups of (male) humans be hostile towards strangers, when there is no competition and they are no threat to each other, only possible help? How could humans survive underground even for days let alone decades, where there is no food and machines are better equipped to catch their prey? How could humans develop fantastic technologies within a few, what? years? months? weeks? when they barely have food to survive let alone factories, supply lines and indeed the knowledge of the necessary physics. And why would an unbiased machine think that humans killing humans is worse than ants killing ants, lions killing lions or trees suppressing other trees in the first place? And if this machine for some mindless reason must eradicate humans from this world, why not doing it fast, efficient and completely. I could think of may ways, a superhuman intelligence, not doubt, could think of even better ones. And how, to put an end to this pointless discussion, does a super intelligent machine comes to terms with its own evilness if it is evilness it tries to wipe out? Watch this movie if you had a good day and you want to spoil it for yourselves.

This is terrible, i like science fiction but the movie world hasn't made a decent one since I Robot, spare yourself from this.These days if you see John Cusak in a movie, you just know the movie will be crap and it's certainly was true of this one. This movie treats its audience like idiots

Looking for a campy, tongue in cheek movie that's so bad that it's actually good. This is it. Yes there are plot holes and some logic flaws (major ones at that) but I actually enjoyed the movie and have no regrets. Worth watching once just dispense all the other stuff, click the "I believe" button and enjoy.

review_title: Too many Haters (dont understand their negativity)
This movie makes me hope I get Alzheimer's's
review_detailed_main:
I wish you could give this negative starts out of 10....

I hope I get Alzheimer's's so I forget that I ever wasted my time watching this garbage movie. This is honestly the worst movie I have seen since Sharknado.... Actually I think Sharknado was significantly better than this. I feel sorry for the actors who thought it was a good idea to take a role in this.

review_title: We are all dumber for this movie's existence
review_detailed_main:
Dialogue aimed at 10 year olds. Ex machina spoon feeding you at every crucial plot twist. 1997 computer graphics. Completely wooden acting from nearly every character, moved along by unbelievable motivations.

I should have shut it off 20 minutes in! Did Cusack really need a paycheck this badly?
I've seen a porn with better acting. Worst movie i saw in last 10 years.

I should have known it was going to be baaaaaaaaad based on how long the introduction was, where about 20 minutes in, I decided to fast forward it to the last 15 minutes, because I was sure I'd see some action now, but it was still baaaaad,, still boring, where I FF to the last minute, and THAT was just as baaaaaaaaad, but at least it was over.

Cusack!

That's going to be my new word for suck b**ls!

The cliché subject matter of this film (revealed in the first 5 minutes) set aside, the weakness of this movie is simply the lack of common sense in all story aspects. Well, that and a terrible script, awful directing and amateurish acting-- even from the seasoned veterans, who apparently have no other expressions than detached boredom (main villain), open-eyed goofy wonder (male lead), and disappointing dullness from veteran Carmen Argenziano. The only decent acting in the entire film is from female lead Jeannine Wacker... but the lines they gave her were just unbelievable.

Examples of plot dis-continuity:

* A Polaroid camera that still has a working battery, flash and film after decades of sitting on a shelf.

* Julia plays a "Hunger Games"-esque female that carries a bulky crossbow as her weapon-of-choice. (In a world where she could have about any weapon she might find, this cumbersome contraption would be one of the least viable.) (Did she even use it in the film?)

* Her almost-instant acceptance of the male character, who frankly just appears out of nowhere looking like a model from a teen magazine-- with no real questions as to 1) why he has no weapons or supplies 2) Where he came from 3) How he got there 4) And just accepting the very lame answers he gives to her limited questions.

* An AI construct retaining a human body (badly damaged at that). Nice "head glow" effect... just rather unbelievable.

The list goes on. As science fiction goes, this has very little science and a whole heap of fiction. Add to this long stretches of unnecessary scenes and trite dialog that can only be described as tedious and we have a predictably ludicrous and nonsensical ending to top off 90 minutes of uninteresting schlock.

The CGI is decent; the robots are believably awesome (if now cliché, having appeared in this form in many films. What are these, rent-a-bot models from a 3-D program?).

But the film just drags. By the time you're into the 40 minute point you'll be wondering if you should play solitaire on your cell phone to fill in the dull periods while you wait for the movie to get around to the end.

This is a bad film. Rather than watching this, re-wash clean dishes. You'll accomplish more with your time.

review_title: highlight beauty of simple things, and the beginning & end of artificial intelligence dilemma
review_detailed_main:
It is set at the point in time of the rise of artificial being, and then it is set 5-generation into the future as Earth is devoid of humanity.

Although people might be excited & desired to see the first part of the movie for its forward prediction on life & society of the future (which is brief), the second part is secretly & slowly highlight of the beauty of simple things with highly detailed & colourful shot of natures & characters as the character move forward the storyline to end the artificial intelligence dilemma as its closing story arc (and open a new one).

This is a fresh story as the beginning & end of artificial intelligence rise is referred to by many times in various sci-fi future mythology but never played out, especially in video games.

review_title: Rise of machines with ultimate judgement day.........
review_detailed_main:
In many thoughts this movie is a combined idea of Terminator the Rise of machines and the judgement day. Only the time machine part of terminator is absent here. It also starts with the applied use of a supercomputer to control human beings. But as we know the machines always rise above the humans it is also not an exception.

Although many audience find boring to see these type of robotics Sci-Fi as they all share a more or less common idea. The first part of that belongs to the Machines and their domination and the second part reflects the fight back of man. This Sci-fi also goes in the same orbit.

But some things are different here. It is more concern with human bondage and it lacks of heavy machinery apparatus that frequently unloads the movie. It has made a good combination of action and slow rising tensions between computer and the survivors of human being..So you will not find the movie as only a sci-fi rather it is a mixture of drama, romance and hardwares and softwares also.

Those who like to see Robotics Sci-fi will enjoy it surely. The Terminator series..Ex machina..Blade runner..Robo cop...Cyborg..is these are liked by you then you are the candidate for this movie...Rest of all i am not sure.

review_title: Low End, Low screenplay, low everything
review_detailed_main:
Take a bit of Matrix, Terminator, 2 young actors, 1 (normally) good actor (just here to pay the bills), shake well and You'll get Singularity.

Just several problems: screenplay is weak, ugly SFX effects, and the actors have charisma equals to my dog........(an insult for my dog)

Forget about this film, and beware false ratings....

Unbelievable. I saw an 8/10 and so watched the movie in the hope to see some "Transcendence"-sort of making. Cusak in the cast seemed OK ... never felt so betrayed. There is nothing - and I mean literally nothing - that wouldn't be lousy in this movie. The actors, all of them, including but not limited to Cusak look like a bunch of high-school drama group newbies trying to improvise their 1st act.

The "special effects" are really very special, someone probably dusted off an Atari ST just to prove it could be used for SFX in 2017. I will most certainly remember the names Robert Kouba (director) and Sebastian Cepeda (story) and avoid any of their future cinematographic creations like the plague. I recommend you do the same.

Honestly, I am just missing the words how bad this movie is. As a high school movie project this would get an E - best case. This is my 1st review on IMDb ever and I can recommend this movie to serve as one purpose only: torture.

review_title: Spoiler alert - observing paint dry is FAR more entertaining

review_detailed_main:
This is a blatant attempt at beginning a new teen scifi franchise in the same vein as Divergent or the Maze Runners, but thankfully due to how badly this bombed it won't happen.

Alas due to that it means this film is incomplete and that damages an already poor excuse for a movie.

I gave this a chance as I'm a big John Cusack fan but as with a lot of his films lately even he couldn't save it.

It tells the story of a world taken over by an artificial intelligence and the remaining humans fighting for survival.

There is a twist, it's just not very good and has been done before.

The film isn't as smart as I think the creators think it is, it's generic, messy and unlikeable.

The one thing (Other than Cusack) that this Swiss/US collab has is the leading lady, a Swiss girl by the name of Jeannine Wacker. She was great and despite her not even having a single photo on her IMDB profile I wish good things for her.

The Good:

Jeannine Wacker is great

The Bad:

Pretencious

Unoriginal

Open ended finale with no sequel

Things I Learnt From This Movie:

When people die all they leave behind are their skulls

The ropes tying him to the tree were about as tight as a Kardashian

Movies need be cornfield scenes

John Cusacks career is nose diving faster than a flat earthers argument

review_title: Probably one of the worst movies ever made
review_detailed_main: When I decided to watch this, it had a 7.2 rating. By then I didn't consider that the reason for this score were fake ratings. Why should I? There's John Cusack, and an interesting description. I just went for it. When I started to watch this I couldn't believe it. Most people in this movie did a lousy job, especially the director, screenwriters, actors, special effects team, even make up artists. But the saddest thing about this "movie" was seeing a good actor who clearly doesn't want to be there. You almost can hear his thoughts while he's "acting": "What have I done?" "Why did I agree to this?". Finally, it's a very low move to save money that could be spent on the movie, just to buy fake IMDb ratings. Besides being illegal, maybe the quality would have been a bit better, like two stars instead of one. This is only suitable for one of those marathons with friends of the worst movies ever made, to laugh at it.

In the near future, most households have a robot from VA Industries. They produced fighting robots to end wars but are blamed for more wars. In 2020, company CEO Elias Van Dorne (John Cusack) initiates computer AI Kronos and it immediately declares war on humanity as the cause of all of the world's ills. Another 97 years later, Andrew Davis is unarmed and running from a killer robot in a deserted town. Calia uses her last electromagnetic bomb to save him.

John Cusack looks tired and old. Of course, we can't be young forever. He's a minor character anyways. He probably spent a day on that set to collect the cheque. Other than Cusack and Carmen Argenziano, these are amateur actors doing most of the heavy lifting. The special effect also looks amateurish with student level work CG. Action often happens with the characters staring in awe at the CG in the distant. Most disappointing is the lack of set design. It's 100 years into the apocalyptic future and the world isn't overgrown. The places look abandoned but only for a few months at most. I don't know anything about the production. The budget is probably too low to make this look good. There are also bad story elements. Calia should have figured something is wrong with Andrew right from the start. It's so obvious that I was waiting for that precise twist to happen. There are countless other problems. This is only a lower grade B-movie.

The writing of a five year old. Horrible dialogue, unlikable characters. Surprised John Kusack showed up in such a stinker. It was like a bunch of unconnected thoughts tied poorly together.

You can only called one movie the worst movie in the last 10 years. This is it!
Awesome movie! But it really deserves a sequel or/and book

Not sure why there are so many negative comments. Not the best film ever by far. But reasonable plot, effective acting, special effects where needed. Overall ok to watch. If you are only interested in mega budget films then you are missing the point. Entertainment is looking for new ideas, seeing new plots, different viewpoints, new actors. Not the same story written over and over again, with the same so called big star actors

This is my first ever review, and it won't be so much a review as it is warning and advice not to watch this movie. Stupidest and more idiotic movies seen in a very long time. No point in going to details, the people before me already wrote it down... Justin DON'T waste you time on this crap.

A boring story came with bad acting and nonsense dialog together in this movie. I barely could watch it until the end. I really don't understand, how it's possible for such a bad movie gets this high rating. Don't waste your time with "Singularity"! It's a pretty bad movie
Every single thing about this film is just plain awful - the script, acting, sets, fx, literally everything

Please do that. Scramble my brains. Gouge my eyes. Cut off my hands that operate remote controls. Make me forget I watched this crap movie. Horrid acting, a worst script (using worst appropriately based on this movie's grammar), and a very terrible plot. The singularity here is that all my emotions left me and I now go without. This empty feeling inside the movie part of my soul will never be occupied by anything other than a vacuum. We are all dumber for having watched this...any burnt out principal would agree with me.

review_title: Why are there no negative values possible for rating this?

review_detailed_main: Users marifislam and kAYLE_B appear to be the same, even copy and paste the review of one movie (The Timber 2015) into the other (Nobody's Perfect 2016). There are more very suspicious individuals, most with accounts in Canada and reviews on the same movies. This movie is not even worth reviewing. Stopped midway and only plan to finish if the world gets attacked by AI and I am about to die.

What goes on in the heads of movie producers & directors these days? Are they so offensively arrogant, that they believe that the cinema-going public will simply lap up crap like this?

Do yourself a favour. If you want to immerse yourself in some quality Sci-Fi, go see Bladerunner 2049 or something old like the Terminator. Avoid this like the plague.

This is a straight to DVD, afternoon TV Movie quality that is almost entirely as unwatchable in its conception as it is in its execution. John Cusack and Carmen Argenziano at their absolute worst. You two should hang your heads in shame - where's your creative pride guys?

What a piece of garbage. Really bad acting and the story was really thin. The lead actor where not believable and fell short almost all of the time. Good looking does not mean you are a good actor! It also had a bad story,and that's to bad because it had potentials. Also some bad cuts here and there,for example,1 photo fell to the floor in one scene,the next cut the photo was in the sofa,magic! NOT! Would not recommend it at all, just waste of time!

I found this film by accident and wasn't very impressed at first. It looked like yet another cheap sci-fi straight to vod production but I didn't really have anything else to do so I rented it and boy was I wrong.

This film is very well done. The execution is superb and the story is unique (even though the concept is familiar). I love the conflict between the boy and the girl and was hooked from the very beginning! (keep in mind I just wanted to watch and laugh for a few minutes at cheap cgi but ended up watching the whole thing because I was just so drawn into the story).

The concept feels like something you might've seen before but the film offers so much more than just good looking visuals. It's a story about our own humanity and brings up a very poetic question Can an artificial intelligence feel love?".

I don't know where this movie came from and I initially thought it would be complete rubbish but I ended up really enjoying it. I would definitely recommend it!

Around 2020, Elias Van Dorne (John Cusack) has a company that produces military grade robots created by a super computer called Kronos for the purpose of ending all wars. His ultimate goal is for these robots to kill all humans because Elias has decided humans are the cancer that cause all the problems in the world. And this is done and world-wide wars break out all over and humans are killed off. Elias is obsessed with Arora - the last human strong- hold - but he doesn't know where it is, and he sees one human still alive and her name is Calia (Jeannine Wacker) and her purpose is to go to Arora. Elias makes a human machine called Andrew to befriend Calia so she will trust Andrew and take him with her to Arora. Then Elias will destroy it.

Elias and his brother Damien (Carmen Argenziano) somehow encase themselves within Kronos and are able to live forever. (How is that possible?) Don't ask, it's complicated. Now 97-years later Elias watches Andrew and Calia travel to Arora. Along the way we see other humans but Elias has no interest in them, but only in Calia and her drive to find Arora.

Well, this is certainly upsetting. Is this the end game for all of us? Debate among yourselves.

What will Calia do when she learns that Andrew is a human machine? Remember, we were told earlier that even Andrew doesn't know.

The only thing I have an issue with is the year that began all this and it should have been started much later than 2020 mostly because of the technology involved. See? (More complications?) Yes.

Okay, more issues: If all humans have been killed off, where did Calia get what looked like new clothes? The buildings still standing looked well kept for the most part. ( Hey, remember that in a dream or now in a Sci-Fi movie anything is possible. Stop being so picky.)

I cannot go any further without giving all away (There's more?) Yes, a lot more. A really big twist will happen and it surprised all of us. Stop it. You will never guess what it is. (Bummer)

This is a very strange, creative, upsetting and can this really happen in time story? Again, debate among yourselves. (7/10)

Violence: Yes. Sex: No. Nudity: No. Language: No.

There are much beater ways to spent 90 minutes of your life then to watch this movie.

Main male and female protagonist should really considered finding a new profession. Acting is not for them.

John Cusack didn't need this to be in his Filmography.

review_title: So bad that it hurts, and not in a cult classic kind of way. If someone offers you $50 to watch it I would ask for a little more.
review_detailed_main: A numbingly familiar plot line is made to look better next to the abomination that is the 'Singularity's script, dialogue, and acting. It feels less like a movie and more like someone poorly edited together cliché snippets of dialogue from the most trite moments of similar movies. The soundtrack kept me on edge like Comcast customer service hold music. The pallid lighting together with John Cusack's makeup and cosmetic surgery do make him look fittingly non-human, but I think that was only coincidental. Julian Schaffner's performance will make you wonder what casting agent thought he was attractive enough to sleep his way into a role. On the other hand, the with other leading character, it is hard to tell if Jeannine Wacker's performance was consumingly terrible or just poor and struggling against vomit inducing directing and script writing. "And...surprised look: "Were you awake just then!?" ...cut" The CGI was surprisingly palatable, to those artists; i'm sorry you had to work on this film. I'm even more sorry if you had to attend the premiere only to see your pretty decent work be mixed in with the rest of this cinematic excrement. To give you perspective; I have written and posted my only review ever here since there were none on RT just to save others from being tricked by a popular actor's name into thinking this is a watchable movie. If you like the Walking Dead or War of the Worlds but wished they were more like After Earth and a bucket of poop written by a lazy AI program that strings together movie clichés with poor scene cuts; then you will love this film. I can't wait for a decent movie with an actual focus on the singularity to come along so that this movie can be differentiated as 'Singularity (2017, poop)'. The only redeemable part of the movie is the end when you see that they are setting it up for a sequel, which will give you a good laugh because someone could have actually watched the finished product and still thought a sequel could possibly ever be funded or made.

review_title: The male lead has a designer hair cut in the apocalyps, why????
review_detailed_main: How does the main lead have perfectly new store bought clothes and a salon haircut????

review_title: Please, do not watch this movie

review_detailed_main:
Looks good visually, not great, just not bad. Pretty well everything else about this movie was bad. The plot made no sense. The acting was poor. The movie wasn't even enjoyably bad. It was just mediocre and pointless.

Not worth watching.
Interesting concept with a seemingly formula production done by committee and reduced to Boy meets girl, blah blah blah.

review_title: Exactly like Terminator......if it was poorly written and acted.
review_detailed_main:
Before I talk about this "movie" I really need to have this one major question that needs to be answered.

Can someone please explain why was John Cusack wearing lipstick....yes I said lipstick. I'm guessing he doesn't look menacing enough with his bad hair transplant/weave/extensions/dead rodent hairstyle? I should have known to shut it off then but couldn't find the remote, wish I had looked a little harder in retrospect.

This movie felt like a Asylum version of Terminator, complete with crappy CGI, a plot that seems to go nowhere and main characters that you could care less if they lived or died. Basically think of every cliché hero/villain, every cliché situation those hero's and villains can find themselves and this is what you get.

I genuinely tried to like this movie, even though I should no better by now to skip Cusack's movies, his One Crazy Summer and Gross Point Blank days have long since passed, along with his hairline and good judgement when it comes to taking roles.

Really hoping this truly is a Singularity as I definitely wouldn't watch a sequel.

review_title: Like A Scifi Channel Reject - Terminator vs Hunger Games
review_detailed_main:
What is it with John Cusack , he has gone from superb movies to taking any old part that comes along - He has gone down the what i call the Ron Perlman and Lance Henriksen road - ie Brilliant actors who have either gotten too old or just decided to take the money and run and its really quite sad to see such giants of the silver screen reduced to taking turdula like this on. I have to disagree with the one reviewer who has said 2012 and Cell were terrible - they weren't that bad - Cell started well but kinda lost its way and 2012 was a superb film i thought!

I don't know but Mr Cusack seems to have had so many face lifts he actually looks like a woman now as well and he seems to permanently be black boot polishing his hair to keep it from grey. Obviously not growing old gracefully - he actually looks like a bit of a freak now.

The movie itself; well I was really looking forward to the first full Robert Kouba movie after the most excellent short "THE RIFT" and unfortunately we have been sadly let down.

Its as though they spent the budget on the first 20 minutes as it started so well but like so many other movies it just lost its way and the effects became cheap and nasty looking. The story itself started well and then went completely to hell at the end - if anyone has a clue as to how humans or aliens or whatever existed and how the golden city skyscrapers of Aurora was created let me know as it just leaves the viewer saying "whaaaaat" at the end - its plain and obvious that they were deluded enough to think at the end that the movie was going to be a hit so left us with the remnants of possibility of a second movie to explain just what the heck the end was all about.

It was also sad to see so many parts ripped from other movies - my brother immediately pointed out the skulls in the water reminiscent of the original terminator and they actually used the same voice-over telling the tale of the machines destroying humanity almost word for word from the original terminator.

Now here is what gets me - the main actor Julian Schaffner was absolutely the worst i have ever seen , in fact its an insult to call him an actor and quite sad when there are so many other talented young actors out there who could have brought something to this movie - no emotion it was as if he was reading off a card or like many actors like Jonny Depp and Gerard Butler to mention two who have a microphone in their ear and the script read to them - the difference is that Johnny Depp is a superb actor and this guy hadn't even had a full movie under his belt - it also transpires that he co-produced it so presumably mummy and daddy in Switzerland paid for his first movie Jolly - To be fair the female lead was not bad and you could see her trying so hard to battle with the script and awful actor she was with I just felt so sorry for her!

Sad also to see Stargate SG-1's brilliant Carmen Argenziano waste his time on this as well. I wouldn't waste your time on this as the whole thing is like some student movie written on the back of a cigarette packet and not a very good one at that. I think that if Robert Kouba had more money and a much better script he would have made a memorable movie; going by his past short films - such a shame for him that his first major movie outing would be so lame.

One point I would like to agree with one of the reviewers - there aren't many films that are worth a 1 rating (except maybe the exceptionally arty farty Keanu Reeves BAD BATCH lol) so I think most of the 1 ratings are a bit unfair - the start of the film was good and I think they possibly did the best they could with the budget - what cannot be forgiven is giving a non- entity like Schaffner who clearly cannot act the chance so star in this and that is what is unforgivable and worth a 1 - overall its a 4/10 for me. To me 5 is average and 4 is less than average. This is a lot better than some of the movies masquerading as Scifi out there - not many but a few and Robert Kouba does try and do a good job with a smal amount of money - I think the brilliant THE RIFT was made with just $20,000 which always impressed me so in all fairness its not decent to give this a 1 out of 10 that is unfair.

What is also unfair are these Chinese and Pakistani review shills - you can actually buy reviews so i have found over on a site called fiverr - its so obvious who these are and why IMDb cannot filter them out is beyond me - let me give an example - reviewer who have been members for a few days and only posted 1 review and its a 10/10 - On here Davelenox from Lugano in Switzerland i presume is Schaffners mum or dad or how about the 1 review 1 days member samuel-93041 who gives it 8/10 - cmon IMDb weed these guys out - no profile - no picture 1 review its not that hard. Although sites like fiverr are now getting genuine members to give good reviews with of course the monetary incentive so i guess its getting harder to weed out the shill reviewers.

Thought at first not to watch it .. but worth the time in the end for me .. hence the review the film having started as a kickstarter with later cut in cusack and low production budget as a whole it is a remarkable piece for my taste. true the story has been told before - but after having watched it, even though the storyline seems straight forward - it left me with a better feeling than many recent scifi flics ..

I thoroughly enjoyed this film. It is a happy exception to the fact that there is no such thing as a good sci-fi movie. Sure, it's a far out story --- a computer takes over the world --- but many sci-fi classics (books, not movies) have spun even wilder ideas. I can see why the story line might daunt people who don't read science-fiction (my wife, for example, reviled it). But for those of us who do, it was quite in line. There were no gross fallacies or questionable science. Not a classic like 2001. But still a decent evening for anybody who enjoys Bradbury, Asimov and Clarke.

review_title: An original plot with so many unexpected twists...not!
review_detailed_main: Are people really that desperate for apocalyptic sci-fi that they'll sit through this completely derivative schlock? Every single concept has been done before...and better by other movies. I don't want to list spoilers here, but I can certainly reference the movies from which plot points were lifted in whole cloth, particularly Terminator and Battlestar Galactica with a bit of Maze Runner thrown in (and in this plot-blender-omatic, I apologize to those movies I failed to list). It wasn't that the acting or special effects were particularly dreadful or laughable...it's just a pointless, yawn-inducing movie which is why I'm giving it only 2 stars.

review_title: This movie is an embarrassment to the genre
review_detailed_main: This has to be a student project. Weak story, horrific acting, 1st year film student level special effects. John Cusack must have owed someone a favor.

review_title: Not quite incompetent enough to be so bad it's good
review_detailed_main:
I've watched about 20 minutes of this preposterously written and conceived turkey, wondering if I should go on. Even the titles, the voice-overs, and the news reader, are badly done. The first shot of a woman in a room with what I take to be our future hero, his mother, I presume, with an oxygen tube, looks exactly like it's shot in the corner of a sound stage. You can almost smell the Klieg lights, Even seated, I'm afraid I might trip over the lighting cables. It's that bad. Now, when Guy Maddin shoots this way. ("Careful," "The Forbidden Room"), it's intentional. You're supposed to laugh at these strange cowardly creatures who live as if the world would crash in if they raise their voices. It works as a metaphor. It's all those people who live this way and look terrified if you walk onto a bus without staring at the tops of your shoes.

But there's no metaphor here. This professes to be the real thing. John Cusack.. What can he be thinking? Does he believe in this nonsense? Does he believe tech people are slightly less than one-dimensional monsters? His performance gives "wooden" a new threshold under which to limbo.

If you were looking for a movie that shamelessly lifts from sci-fi classics (Terminator/Blade Runner/The Hunger Games) but also provides you with acting more robotic than the actual robots in the film, then Singularity is for you. John Cusack, who is clearly desperate to receive a paycheck, may have actually displayed the most wooden performance of all and in all likelihood shot his scenes in the span of one disinterested hour.

Oh John Cusack, what in the hell happened to your career? The fact that Cusack, who has starred in so many movies that I cherish from my childhood, is in this is the scariest thing about this movie. *sigh* Oh well.

So briefly, this your standard "computer achieves self-awareness and immediately decides to kill all humans" cliche. Like Skynet in Terminator but so, so much worse. Every writing, acting and directing choice in this movie is a complete head scratcher.

Cusack plays his role without an ounce of emotion or nuance. They might have literally filmed his scenes by FaceTiming with him and having him just read the script over the phone. But he's hardly alone when it comes to horrible acting in this movie; all of the performances are completely uninspired.

My working theory is that the movie studio actually built an AI and tasked it with writing, directing and editing the movie..It then scanned every television movie of the week from the mid eighties to the late nineties about rogue AIs and decided to approximate the ideas from those films for this one.

There are tons of plot holes, of course, because the AI didn't really understand what "humans" were and guessed that they were kind of like voice emulators that occasionally moved and turned off if hit with CGI bullets. So it got confused and decided that Skynet could turn off 8 billion humans everywhere on the planet overnight, but that the other humans could just escape that...somehow.

It's explained what happened but not how in gods name it makes a shred of sense. I don't want to spoil it for you, but it's pretty banana-bread bonkers. Unless, as I said, you view the plot thru the "eyes" of an AI that doesn't quite get what humans are.

I think the AI also struggled with the notion of the "real world", because one hundred years later lawns and buildings are pretty much just the same as they used to be, suggesting that the AI doesn't quite grasp the concept of growth and time. Although I suppose maybe Skynet was sending maintenance crews around to mow lawns and fix roofs and windows and stuff, which was pretty nice of it if you think about it. Gotta keep those property values up.

So in summary the AI made the humans move around a little and say things, mostly dialogue from other movies I'm guessing, and would occasionally turn them off with CGI bullets and explosions until there were only a few left. Then some other stuff happened, I think.

Or something like that. I don't know, I stopped watching around 25 minutes, flipped ahead to see how it ended, then watched High Fidelity and felt very old and sad.
A complete waste of time. The plot makes no sense and goes nowhere. Why would anyone make this dreck? Why would anyone agree to be in it? Having filmed it, why would you edit and release it?

review_title: I understand that this movie is Low Budget, but hear me out...
review_detailed_main:
I get what everyone is saying. "How can a movie like this exist?" "Why would they make it?" "Everyone looks too healthy..." Etc...

Listen. If you like sci-fi movies that are very interesting and keep you around because you must see what happens next, then this movie is perfect for you.

Yes it is low budget and the acting is not the absolute best, but look past all of that. This movie is so interesting and I loved the ending! It really makes you root for the main characters to do whatever it takes to reach Aurora.

And did I mention that I loved the ending? I really felt like I was a part of the story.

Movie snobs will never give this a chance. But if that is not you, then go for it! I'm very happy I did and I hope they make a sequel.

This movie has great potential. It felt more like a tv pilot then a movie. Which I think I would have been a great tv show. It ends abruptly like a show that gets canceled halfway into a season. I don't feel like it's a bad movie just rushed and a bit out of order from here to there and back again. Not really connecting the dots

review_title: Wow - disappointing would be a step up

review_detailed_main: The only way this movie can be enjoyed is with a few pals to get to together for a laugh, this film is totally game to be torn to peices. Funny acting, funny script, bad concepts, this needs to be taken to the cleaners by anyone who watches this.

review_title: this is a pretty horrible movie
review_detailed_main:
The acting is poor. the kids do their best but....they fail. script is from the 60's. main girl is a rip off of hunger games. they never even get dirty in all their adventures.

i gave up half way through.

An absolutely pitiful indie sci-fi drama whose merits, or lack thereof, become clear when examining the origins. This was originally a low budget Swiss drama about a young couple making their way through a devastated landscape towards a place of safety. Later, the film was brought by an American company and new scenes involving a cameoing John Cusack and a robot apocalypse were added. Needless to say the two elements don't gel and both are awful anyway.
Apparently Kronos didn't kill the barbers because Andrew has a pretty fresh haircut.

review_title: How many ways is this movie bad?
review_detailed_main: Let's start with John Cusak who emotes as if he just graduated from a mail order acting school, which perhaps is only appropriate given that he mailed in his performance. We can add that the plot is totally simplistic and the presentation is totally devoid of suspense and drama. The two young members of the cast were earnest enough and no doubt felt as if they were contributing to a watchable movie as they labored before the camera, but sadly their contribution was totally misplaced and seemed to belong in a different movie altogether. Movies like this one give you reason to be thankful for streaming. One can fast forward and learn almost immediately that this effort is not worth your effort. Imagine having to sit in a theater and being forced to learn this minute by minute.

Apparently everyone else got to this one before I did. I figured if it showed up on Netflix and has John Cusack phoning it in, it must at least be worth a bit of dumb fun. I actually marginally enjoyed a similar kind of movie that appeared on Netflix starring Lee Pace as an American mercenary in an African country when an alien invasion happens.

But this one is just stupid. Flat out stupid. Even by the lowest of low-budget standards, this is stupid. This is 4th grade sci-fi stupid. This is too stupid even for that. It was so stupid I couldn't get more than 20 minutes into it.

Firstly, the movie sets us up in 2019 where there are helpful robots everywhere from a corporation run by John Cusack's character, while he one night ominously decides to run Kronos, the first ever AI. to absolutely no surprise at all, Kronos awakens, and apparently decides, in it's dime store 5th grade sociology wisdom, that "there's a problem with earth, and the problem is humans are bad and dumb and must be destroyed using nuclear weapons in order to save earth" because we all know when you need to exterminate termites or cockroaches from your house, the best method is to take a sledgehammer and smash up all the walls and floors.

next, we're shown that John Cusack and his sidekick guy are actually AI beings themselves, in human guise, which kind of renders the whole Kronos gimmick pointless since they are already AI and have already made the decision to end all human life on earth, so why even bother making a show of this brand new first ever AI? Why even tell any of the humans?

all of this is relayed in a numbingly monotonous exposition dump voice-over from an actor who turns out to be a complete ripoff of Katniss Everdeen from the hunger games when she arrives, and is unbelievably badly acted. Not even badly acted to a degree that it is fun to mock, but just boringly badly acted. she announces it is 97 years later and earth sucks now

the other element added in is some random teenaged boy in his mid-20s who somehow managed to survive the initial apocalypse and is now inexplicably wandering around 97 years later. But this is helpfully explained by John Cusack and his sidekick that this guy is secretly a robot like them, completely indistinguishable from human, who ALSO is unaware he's a robot!

Caving in like a wet cardboard roof is; if this kid thinks he's human HOW HAS HE BEEN LIVING FOR 97+ YEARS WITHOUT AGING? On top of this stupidity, he gets attacked by a random robot and escapes, and the sidekick pointlessly asks John Cusack why he sent the robot to attack him, and John Cusack says so Katniss can trust him, implying that him being a human wandering around on his own post-apocalypse where robots kill all humans on sight isn't enough to get her interest.

MAYBE she has experienced androids in human disguise at some point and so now can't trust all humans, but this was not mentioned in the minutes leading up to or coming after this, and at that point around 20 minutes in I just flat-out gave up on this stupid pile of stupid and ended it.

Are they just giving away money to anyone to make movies now? if so can i get on that list plz. I knew the ratings were bad when i started to watch this movie, but that is usually the case with B-rate scifi movies, which then usually turn out to be great in my book. This was a waste of time, nothing about this movie was even remotely interesting
First movie that Netflix can make a trilogy. Why are people so harsh on a great script! Can't wait for a sequel!

Although there are some imperfections in this movie, and it's true that John Cusack is not convincing in his role, overall it's not a bad movie.

I enjoyed the visual effects, and some of the acting was very good, especially by Jeannine Wacker as Calia.

This is by far the worst movie of 2017. Just don't watch it, it's a waste of time!! So many mistakes and dumb actions. Casting is awful. the story is probably written by a child. I just cannot believe that this movie is made in 2017, well if you watch this movie you will remember this review and agree.

review_title: This movie could have EASILY been an 8, but it WASN'T
A 22 years old director's first film with $100,000 budget
review_detailed_main: Indeed it could have been better, but come on, it is just an amateur effort of a young fellow on a miniscule budget.

Just to say it out loud and clear ; 'Don't watch that movie.It's a total waste of your valuable time.The story is none to nothing.....oh! We have an AI that's killing all the humans on the planet....seems to me that movie makers are stuck in an eternal loop of the same 'sh...'.And then there was the acting....oh my god.....it was so awfully bad.Julian Schaffner should stop acting and start a career at MC Donald's....would be better for him and for us.Don't let you fool by the rating.....believe me just don't watch it.!!

review_title: I'm not surprised this movie is from Switzerland, it's cheesy and full of holes.
Lacklustre performances make for painful viewing

review_detailed_main:
A slick but empty YA dystopian film with 'borrowed' themes from far superior Sci-Fi like Blade Runner, The Matrix and even Planet of the Apes. The opening production value and John Cusack's presence lend the film enough credibility to lure you in, then quickly flounders into poor melodrama with even worse writing.

It feels like a film that had a story and vision at one time, then found itself over-budget and went into turnaround. Over eager Writer/Director Robert Kouba clearly focused on the opening and conclusion, putting everything into the special effects and even a soundtrack by members of The Crystal Method. Suddenly with no money left, and little more than a student film reel in the can, Kouba roughly stitched together some nonsensical plot points with flat characters and even flatter acting to fill out the 93 minute runtime.

The ultimate tragedy is that it clearly sets up for a sequel, so it feels less like a complete film than a bloated trailer to some yet-to-come flick. I dare say that film isn't coming and I hope you already cashed that paycheck, John.

So many negative exaggerations....I personally liked the movie and I think it leads perfectly into the option of a sequel. I don't know what more to say except watch for the movie it is, not the movies it isn't. In other words, don't compare it to another movie. The girls accent is very choppy but I think that's just the way she speaks and I actually came to enjoy listening to her. I enjoyed the movie.

It says more about John Cusack's career than anything else that he's punched out around 10 minutes of acting on a green screen to give this thing some cred. The writer director had success in the short film market - who doesn't - but can't maintain the rage, much less the conceptual content past the 15 minute mark. With too many references to other movies, there is hardly one original idea here. You sort of hope that in this nice looking but otherwise wretched thing there is some hope - perhaps it is a movie about the human condition, or the potential down side of AI, or - who really cares...

The production values are good - very good - and that is what kept me watching to the end, but the dialog, story and concepts are ordinary, a blend of things you've seen and sad...in that order.

I have a very simple scoring system - under 5 is some variation of I wish I'd seen something better - 6 is good, 7 is i'd recommend and above that we're moving into the great movies - this is a 4.5 - I rounded up because i'd seen some good movies this week.

Just no. I made an account only to say NO. I have watched movies to kill time a million times that have no plot, budget or cgi. This movie is Terminator Salvation, if everyone on the crew was in a highschool AV club.

So horrible graphic, please do not watch this movie or your eyes will burn. Watch any other movie you haven't seen yet but please, skip this one. Special effects are dire - in the opening scenes burning buildings look like someone went mad with the Photoshop clone tool. Explosions don't cast any light on objects that are close by and clouds of dense smoke don't cast any shadows and dissipate in moments leaving no trace. Enormous bots appear to defy the laws of physics and move through dense forestry without causing a single tree to move. Lighting.... I mean really.... what is happening with the lighting? In a dark and dingy forest, and it looks like two blazing follow spots behind the cameras.... just cheap and nasty.

review_title: "Terminator" at "Bladerunner" speed, written by the writers from "Lost".

review_detailed_main: John Cusack and Carmen Argenziano are seasoned mainstream actors. I hope both of them fired their agents for allowing them anywhere near this worththless film.

This is just awful...

weak story, weak SFX, weak characters...

Now I have to come up with more to say about this...

There are some idiotic plot twists but above all the CGI is so bad it breaks any immersion possible. now if this were some student thesis film with graphics made on a laptop I could understand but how bad is John Cusack's Alcohol problem if he let this piece of rubbish have his name on it...
Singularity is a great movie, loved it! Please do a sequel!

review_title: Not as bad like everyone is saying
review_detailed_main:
To be honest this movie isn't that bad! The choice of cast is a bit off and John Cusack acting was a little off as well but I blame the Director and the script writers. Because this movie just had like a twilight/hunger games/terminator feel to it and I think that's what made this movie bad.

That human love story with some other fictional characters died after twilight and all the copycat tv shows like vampire diaries. The acting wasn't all that bad, it just didn't really have an honest storyline but the concept is there! This movie probably needed a little more thought and time to it because I believe they rushed the movie so they can put it out there ASAP. The copycat twilight love story is the down part to this movie.

I've seen worse movies with horrible actors and low budget qualities and tbh the main guy is kind of cute. The girl is kinda mediocre and John Cusack DID NOT fit that part so Maybe if they got an A-list actor to play either the girl or the guy or if they took a little more time with this movie, it probably would've helped this movie because it does have potential.

Overall it's not a completely bad movie or the worst movie like some of these comments! 5.6/10.

review_title: Easiest money John Cusack ever made
review_detailed_main: Awful is an understatement for this movie. Cusack literally stands or sits in one spot the entire movie. He looks strung out, too. The whole thing just doesn't make any sense. He's monitoring the two main characters (the most generic, boring male protagonist in recent memory and a blatant Catniss Everdeen ripoff. Seriously, it's not even subtle) the entire movie. He looking at images of them from directly in front of them, eye level, and all around. One shot is a close up. I mean, how is he getting these images without a camera? Or are the two main characters completely oblivious? The whole thing is laughable. The funniest thing to me is the ending is an absolute set up for a sequel. There's no way in seven hells that this should have a sequel greenlit.
... but it died very quick. All the bad comments are true.

review_title: That's nothing lower than a one so there you go
review_detailed_main: First thing so what it was a bad movie and the acting as painful as untreated hemroids. I can not have children after having watched this movie. But what is worse is they tried to setup a sequel that means they thought they something that would not strike those who see it dead and any that survive blind and depressed. I never thought about self harm until now.

review_title: I made an account just to give this movie 1 star

review_detailed_main: I wouldn't bother watching this, it will only hert ! In as much you'll never come to terms with yourself for allowing yourself to watch it till the end . Utter Rubbish.

review_title: Corny as I don't know what

review_detailed_main: Is this all John Cusack can get now? Don't recognize any of the other actors. That is not surprising really because such a cheap film. It is obvious they have taken bits from blockbuster sci-fi films and twisted them a bit to make this film. Female lead reminds me a bit of Gemma Arteton.

review_title: Like a very fine Twilight Episode
review_detailed_main:
This is a well paced, well directed, reasonably well acted and entertaining movie, who would've thought? From the story description one might think this is another cliché commercial movie and I must confess that I was not too interested to watch this movie because I expected just another special effects circus. However, as I am a big fan of Science Fiction movies, I thought I would give this film at least a chance. I must say that despite the trailer and some other comments here you will discover a very tender film about remaining good despite living on a destroyed world.

The young actors Andrew and Calia might not be at A level yet but their performance is good enough to let you feel the basic story of friendship and trust. Cusack and Argenziano play their role well and are a good contrast to the young actors. Overall I would recommend this movie to everybody who is interested in watching a film that is more than just special effects. This is definitely not another Terminator movie but more of a very fine Twilight Episode. My final rating: A+

Everything about this film is truly depressingly bad-which is a shame as amongst the mess are some interesting ideas. At least Jeannine Wacker can act, but the rest of the cast? Ouch. I'm not sure who JC was thinking, and the male lead looked like he'd just stumbled out of acting school (after failing). Avoid.

This movie is just bad. It has a similar plot to Terminator-Salvation, just less believable. Yes that's right Terminator-Salvation has less plot holes and better character development. Acting is just plain bad. For 97 years after the apocalypse everyone seems pretty naive about survival skills. It's a waste of time.

review_title: John Cusack's career has jumped the shark
review_detailed_main: I watched this because of John Cusack. He has been in some interesting movies. So many holes in this story. So many jr high play "what's my line" pauses. So many inconsistencies. Fight scenes made WWE look real. 2 minutes in I wondered what am I watching. I watched for another 30 min to let it develop, but then realized this is simply bad and getting worse. Could not believe it had a 4 rating. 4 says it has some promise. This a Singularity turd deserving of a single star.

review_title: Oh just bad. Waste of time.
review_detailed_main: I was a little mad when I finished the movie that I could have spent that time watching literally any other movie. It's really bad. Would not recommend. I could go into why but basically I'm here to tell you don't waste your time. Watch something else. Sorry. But also you're welcome.

review_title: "You're the most dangerous thing that's ever existed. ...I'm leaving."
review_detailed_main: I don't understand all the negative reviews on here...I'm going to be a lot more charitable. Because it's obvious that the kids from the high school film class that somehow scored a hundred thousand dollar budget (and spent 98,000 of that on John Cusack) to do this class project have got enormous potential.

Bad movie, don't waste time. I read some reviews and now I am positive IMDb has fake reviews. Not sure how much extra money the film makers get by putting effort into boosting ratings untruthfully but it would be nice if they just made a movie to be proud about. Bad acting and bad cgi. Only thing good is the baseline of the story.

review_title: Save an hour and just watch Terminator....much better than this!
review_detailed_main:
I watched it because it had John Cusack in it...boy was I wrong to waste my time by watching the entire show. I always think that a movie will have at least some redeeming qualities but this one really disappointed. VERY slow and the script had to be written by a teenager because the dialogue was boring and very predictable. Come on John!...you don't have to star in movies like this, you're better than that!

In the end it was a mix between Terminator and iRobot, just not in a good way. Even for a poorly scripted movie you always hope at least one of the characters steps up and brings a little light to the stage...not in this movie. All the actors, including John deliver performances that equal high school drama. (Trying hard but not pulling it off...) I generously gave it 3 stars since the computer CGI was fairly decent and the robotic machines looked pretty good. At least the animation guys did their job!

I logged on to IMDB to see who the director was and could not believe the user reviews. I can only assume you are all retarded/jaded by TV. This is one of the best sci fi movies I've ever seen. When I want to watch something Sci fi ts a toss up between this and THX 1138.

It a amazingly atmospheric movie 9 (an awesome soundtrack). You make up you own minds but I would never discourage anyone from watching this movie. And to the guy who asks "where is the singularity?" Enjoy you're pointless pedantic experience of life. I hope you are part of the billion the film predicts are wiped out.

Who cares if the characters look good. suspend you disbelief for F's sake and engage wtih the ideas.

B

review_title: Another "it could have been good" movie
review_detailed_main: A billionaire mad scientist (I guess) decides the human race is a bad thing. He attempts to erradicate people and replace them with machines and computers. Not all that original. John Cusack has done some great movies. This isn't one of them. The only thing that saves this film from being a complete steaming pile of crap is the cinematography. The story, script and acting are all pretty awful. I hope the kids are planning on college and real careers.

The kind of movie you half watch while playing games on your phone or cleaning up around your apt/house or....while writing a review, like this one. It's odd seeing Cusack in this kind of role, not a believable or convincing bad guy. File this movie under been there/done that.
This is some of the worst acting I've have seen in some time. The story line is awful. Why John C would agree to this movie, I haven't a clue. I get he is taking his cue from Nicholas Cage.
The acting and the movie was just terrible. It was like watching paint dry.

The acting wasn't bad. That's my glass-half-full perspective. Netflix had this rated 4.5 stars, so I thought I'd give it a try. The story was bad. Not the worst ever to be certain, but it was predictable, and the one big twist at the end made no sense whatsoever. The direction was the worst part. The most glaring miss: After 100 years of humanity being hunted to extinction, two of the last survivors have perfectly coiffed hair and clean clothes. I thought about a drinking game where you do a shot every time you see a plot-hole, but it you'd have alcohol poisoning in the first 30 minutes.
You can use this movie as a torturing device...waste off life.
Bad just bad. I watched it cause it was interesting to see how much worse it could get.

This movie is so bad I can't even justify taking the time to write a complete review. Besides it would take far too long to point out all the faults of this movie, but on the other hand it is easy to point out the positives. There are none.

Singularity is a science fiction film with an eerily dystopian feel, directed by first time director Robert Kouba. It promises the world but does it actually deliver? I believe so. It could've been better if the concept was more unique, and the casting was better but doesn't that happen all the time? I was entertained and it left me wanting for more.

The film moves at a good pace, and the performances given by the main actors are believable and engaging. If you want to enjoy a good indie sci-fi you will find this a perfectly pleasant way to spend a couple of hours.

There was enough of action and intrigue to keep me focused for the duration of the film, and I was actually a little disappointed when the credits rolled. The actors, who to be fair are mostly a bunch of unknowns gave performances to be proud of, and you could feel the drama in the air, even when they would have undoubtedly been acting against the backdrop of the good old green screen.

Would I recommend this film to a friend? Well provided they enjoy movies in the sci-fi arena I certainly would suggest it as a great way to spend an evening. While it is far from Oscar-winning, Singularity is an enjoyable fun romp into a broken world.

review_title: C rated version of Terminator Salvation
review_detailed_main: Gets two stars only because it wasn't that long. Stupid story line, bad acting and a waste of time. Stupidest thing of the movie? They come across other human survivors who actually look like dirty, unkempt and like they live in that one set of clothes 24/7, but the two main characters never get dirty even though they've been going through the woods, wading through nasty water and sleeping on the ground for days in the same clothes. The female lead even has rings on her fingers and never a hair out of place...lol. The male lead always has a stupid wide eyed look on his face. Netflix get your own stories and stop making horrible imitations of the real ones. Like I said, C rated...it's so bad it surpasses bad B rated movies...enough said.

You know the time when you've been forced to use a Portaloo in the middle of summer, straight after someone who's had a massive dump, you remember, the smell, the heat, the flies and the warm seat, well that's Singularity right there. Well it would if you added in the fact that there was no paper left!

review_title: On your marks, get set, TERRIBLE!
review_detailed_main: I occasionally intentionally watch a bad movie just for fun. This took the fun out of that fun! Do you believe in miracles? I do now because it's a miracle that this ever made it past being a script. Can't wait for the sequel!!!

review_title: Came here just to warn others
review_detailed_main: Came to IMDB for the sole purpose of rating this horrible mess of a movie. The worst dialogue and delivery. Cusack needs an intervention. Even he managed to be as horrible as the other actors, which wasn't an easy job. Truly cringeworthy in every respect.

Simply put, I can't grasp how this attempt at a film wasn't litigated against for, at the very least, cherry-picking the entirety of Terminator: Salvation's plot. Cash your check Cusack, while we sit back and laugh at your lack of integrity and creative impetus.

review_title: The entire movie was ruined by....
review_detailed_main: The first ten minutes when the main female role should have said "hey, where the hell are you from and why don't you act like a human should act after 97 years of robot domination? Were you resurrected? Did you come from a cryo tube? Because you're making mistakes that a toddler wouldn't make for fear of killing literally everyone..." I tried to make it past the first twenty minutes because of the main actors, but they screwed me.

Picture this: An eight foot tall Spanish speaking magician forced its way out of your belly button and, as you writhe in agony from the gaping hole in your gut, begins aggressively to persuade you to be the volunteer of the lamest and longest series of card tricks you'd ever muster patience for, but you stick around because John Cusack. This magician experience is more enjoyable and less confusing than the steaming pile of elephant snot Singularity turned out to be. I created an IMDB account solely to find a way to voice my dislike for this movie.

review_title: Destroy All Humans! Destroy All Humans!

review_detailed_main: Listen, this movie has great special effects, the acting was okay. Sure, it had some moments here & there that could use a lot of improvements, but so do most movies. It's not a Star Wars budget movie. I truly have to wonder about the stream of 1 ratings. Who are these people? Perhaps religious extremists who can't accept the thought that AI/AGI/ASI will one day surpass humans in thinking ability & kindness such as Andrew, the teenage boy. Anyhow, those ratings are uncalled for. Shame on those people.

So most of mankind is wiped out by a crazed tech inventor and his creation, Kronos. Pick up the story 97 years later. Ok, so when the characters cross an old railroad track in the woods, there's no 97-year overgrowth. Searching through an old home, not a speck of dust or cobwebs to be seen. Are the machines mowing the grass? Dusting the houses?

Who thought this film through? Aren't there production people that set up a scene for a shoot? I think they were out that day, the entire shooting schedule. I'm fairly certain most 2nd year film student could have done better.

Bad, just bad

review_title: Ninety-nine % of the human race is dead

review_detailed_main:
This film is pretty bad. ... I watch movies of all sorts, all genres, including so-bad-they-are-good movies, doesn't matter the country. I am by no means an expert, but, I do have a little bit of an academic background, having taken some film studies courses in college (covering American film and European film). And I've been exposed to some highlight Bollywood movies, and highlight Asian films (mostly Korean and Japanese films, because I spent some time there.) So, I have a good, broad grasp or sense of knowledge of world cinema in general.

For the best of the worst in horror / fantasy, there are the American treasures 'Plan 9 from Outer Space' and 'Troll 2', and the South Korean 'Dragon Wars: D-War'. For drama, there is Tommy Wiseau's 'The Room'...

This movie is enjoyable in the same vein as these aforementioned gems. It is filled with confusing storytelling, inconsistencies, or at least not-so-believable situations or plot, pretty bad special effects, horrible dialogue, possibly intentionally bad acting, and just plain, blatantly ripped-off elements from other movies. And they pronounce 'Gliese' wrong; it is pronounced 'GLEE-zuh' or 'GLEE-suh'. ... I enjoyed writing my clever title for this review. I highly recommend taking an ambien tablet (or whatever your drug of choice may be) and watching this.

review_title: Hunger Games meets Terminator meets Divergent, not in a good way
Why does Netflix keep giving garbage movies 95+%?
review_detailed_main:
I'm going to be honest. I watched about 30 min of this movie. It's a decent premise with a C- execution. But my real question is why Netflix keep trying to tell me that I'd like garbage films. The Rift was the most ridiculous (you can see my review of that). It's definitely one of the worst movies I've ever seen and Netflix gave it a 97% for me.

This film just has a hackneyed plot, is poorly acted (except for John Cusack who is fine), and has really poor writing. You always know a story is going to suck when a voice over has to tell you what the story should be showing you.

But seriously, Netflix, your algorithm used to be fairly decent. Now I feel like its trying to make me watch garbage and convince me to like it.

review_title: You made me watch THAT with my own 2 eyes?
review_detailed_main:
If this movie were graded like a college research paper the writer would be expelled for plagiarism. They are trying so hard to cash in in the popularity of the Hunger Games they forgot to have anything be original. I will be surprised if there are not lawsuits filed. Yes, it's that bad.

I can forgive bad special effects if the plot and characters are good. Nope. Not in this movie. It's just dismal beginning to end.

This is my first and probably only review of a movie. Save yourself and go take a nap instead.

review_title: Either a joke or rather an insult to SciFi movies
review_detailed_main: The only interesting part of this movie is its title. Rest: weak copy of the Terminator, where you really wonder how could John Cusack give his name to it.

review_title: OMG! Looks like it was Made for 10 Cents!
review_detailed_main:
The guy who said he registered with IMBD just to counter all the fake glowing reviews is right! This is a horrible movie.

Cheaply made like a bad TV movie on SYFY

The acting -- from seasoned actors no less -- is abysmal. It's as if they just needed a paycheck and they walked through with no care.

The writing is moronic. Over the top drama that makes no sense.

The music is a half step above porno music.

The special effects are laffable

And direction? What direction? I've seen Youtube videos that were made better.

Put more simply, there is NOTHING to recommend about this movie. NOTHING

I slept through a lot of this film as it failed to grab my attention from the start. The bits that I did see managed to combine being predictable with being pedestrian.This plot has been done before and far better and I rather wish I'd watched a Terminator instead. There were a few nice (but fairly low budget) effects, but not enough to offset all that wooden acting.
Given it's the first feature this kid (the director) has made, I'll give it a five... no one really starts out at the top of their career. Probably funded it himself.

review_title: I registered on IMDB just to leave an appropriate review for this garbage..
review_detailed_main: Disgusting. Horrid acting. Appalling script. Millions of holes and now coherence. Junior High drama school could do a better plot and film.

...AND I HAD TO TURN IT OFF.

I wasn't at all sure which movie it was they were copying. It was so hard to watch

review_title: Interesting Concept, but the story & screenplay are not fully developed

review_detailed_main: What a terrible script.. it starts off so choppy with the most cliched dialogue and plot ever (and that continues throughout the whole movie), no lead into what should be a devastating action scene, and no emotion to back it up. Hilarious product placement. Cusack is the only actor in the film that we know can act, but he doesn't act in this. They don't even bother buttoning up his suit properly, and then it cuts back to him with it buttoned. I was really sad to see him in this; it's a real low-point. He must really be in debt or something to be willing to embarrass himself like this. I would not be in this, and I've made a lot less money in my life than him!

worst movie in mankind history to ever hit the theaters.

Half of the cinema fled outside before 30 minutes.

Special effects made on Iphone app or so :( just Pathetic ! How did john put his name in this? Actors..like from B grade acting schools.. Money back from cinema ticket :(

First review on this site ever, .... But in can not let this pass me by... this is one of the worst ever made/ so sad.

Story, plot and timeline, this was just put together at random. Even the story is nonsense, not even an attempt to copy a major release movie... Come on!

How can one rate this 10/10... putting all other AI movies to shame.

For all I care the big robot in Robocop "running in stop motion", made a better acting performance then the whole crew of this movie!!!!!

if you see the opportunities one get to release a movie, which are very limited.. this takes a huge amount of airtime to waste for better directors and upcoming talented people.

review_title: If I could put zero I will do it.
review_detailed_main: Story is so sealy like it from fantasy of 5 year boy. Dialogs and actors play like from cazual RPG game without any emotions or mind games. To many cheap movie speceffects... I advise to wath: no one.

review_title: Worst Terminator (& Terminator Salvation) ripoff ever
2 Hours and 19 Minutes You Will Never Get Back
review_detailed_main: Please, if you have any self respect or respect towards your loved ones do not let your eyes see any frame of this god awful movie. If you would even call it a movie and not a just a video made by a child on a camera phone. The story follows the well dressed Katniss Everdeen along with a prepubescent grease ball who looks like he just got out of a dressing room. They are traveling to Aurora. A uncreativley named village where the humans who didn't watch the movie live. Meanwhile, the entire world is being destroyed by a Kronos a poorly named AI and some transformers. The scenes with Cusak are improvised from the filming of a totally different film. The film box officed 4000 dollars. That should be a warning. It is PG 13 because it was rated by 3 year olds. Don't be fooled. The original Imbd rating was 2.0 but it got bumped to 4.6. This is because they bought reviews. Please do not get this film it is a wast of 50 cents that could be spent on cancer research not making movies that are cancerous. So please have Congress ban this movie and to John Cusak. Why?
